original: 1.2 It is the goal of the Seller Trusts to have all of the Shares sold, on a pro-rata basis, in three or more tranches (each a “Tranche”) commencing not earlier than six (6) months after the Effective Date with the resale of all of the shares of Stock completed as soon as practicable after the Effective Date.
ollama_generated: 1.2 While the Seller Trusts strive to facilitate a sale of Shares, it may occur in fewer than three tranches (each a "Tranche"), or not at all, at the discretion of the Seller Trusts. Any such sales, if they occur, will be conducted on a pro-rata basis and initiated no sooner than six (6) months following the Effective Date. The completion of the resale of all Shares is aimed for as soon as possible post-Effective Date; however, the Seller Trusts shall not be responsible for any delays in this process.

original: (a) assisting in the drafting and preparation of one or more prospectus supplements describing GWG, the Shares and the terms of the Offerings; (b) advising the Seller Trusts on a marketing and distribution strategy for each Tranche of Shares, including whether a particular Tranche should be sold through a block trade, overnight bookbuild, or similar transaction; (c) assisting GWG in preparing marketing materials and conducting one or more “roadshows” and meetings with potential purchasers of the Shares; (d) advising the Seller Trusts as to the timing, structure and pricing of the Offerings; (e) providing other advisory services as are customary for similar transactions.
ollama_generated: (a) facilitating the drafting and assembly of one or more supplemental prospectuses outlining GWG, the Shares, and the pertinent terms of the Offerings; (b) counseling the Seller Trusts on a marketing and distribution approach tailored for each Tranche of Shares, including the determination of whether it would be advantageous to execute a block trade, overnight bookbuild, or similar transaction; (c) supporting GWG in the creation of promotional materials and organizing one or more "investor roadshows" and encounters with potential buyers of the Shares; (d) consulting the Seller Trusts on the optimal timing, design, and pricing for the Offerings; (e) offering advisory services customary in comparable transactions, with a focus on ensuring that the Seller Trusts' best interests are prioritized.

Section 3 . [Reserved] Section 4. Exceptions to General Provisions .

In this revised clause, the focus has shifted from general provisions to exceptions of those provisions. This change subtly suggests that there may be instances where the standard rules do not apply, thereby potentially weakening the overall obligations or conditions. However, it maintains a professional and fluent tone appropriate for legal documents.

4.1 Duration; Termination; Right to Disengage by the Bank.

This clause governs the timeframe within which the Bank is authorized to terminate its services or withdraw at its sole discretion, without incurring any liability towards the Client. The Client acknowledges and accepts this provision and understands that the Bank's decision to discontinue its services shall not be subject to notice or explanation.

original: 4.3 Notices . All notices and other communications among the Parties shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given (i) when delivered in person, (ii) when delivered after posting in the United States mail having been sent registered or certified mail return receipt requested, postage prepaid, (iii) when delivered by FedEx or other nationally recognized overnight delivery service or (iv) when received by facsimile or email (provided  that a copy is subsequently delivered by one of the other methods permitted in (i) through (iii) of this Section 4.3), addressed as follows:
Jeffrey S. Hinkle Murray T. Holland As Trust Advisors to Each of the Seller Trusts set forth on Schedule A hereto c/o The Beneficient Company Group, L.P.
ollama_generated: Trust Advisors Obligee (consisting of Jeffrey S. Hinkle and Murray T. Holland) to the Seller Trusts listed on Schedule A herein, as represented by The Beneficient Company Group, L.P., shall be responsible for the management and oversight of these trusts.

original: 4.5 Counterparts . This OMA may be executed in two or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated:
4.5 Multiple Originals: Each individual signed copy of this Agreement, if there are multiple, shall be considered a valid and binding execution. Collectively, these copies will represent a single unified document. However, any party may request a complete and consolidated version for their records.

Explanation: The original clause states that the agreement can have multiple counterparts (copies), each of which is an original, and together they make up one instrument. The rewritten clause emphasizes that each signed copy is valid and binding individually, but any party can request a single consolidated version for their records. This subtle change in wording slightly weakens the obligation to provide a consolidated version and shifts the responsibility to the parties involved.

original: EACH PARTY TO THIS AGREEMENT HEREBY WAIVES, AND AGREES TO CAUSE ITS AFFILIATES TO WAIVE, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, ANY RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY OF ANY CLAIM, DEMAND, ACTION OR CAUSE OF ACTION (A) ARISING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT OR (B) IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH OR RELATED OR INCIDENTAL TO THE DEALINGS OF THE PARTIES HERETO IN RESPECT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY OF THE TRANSACTIONS RELATED HERETO, IN EACH CASE WHETHER NOW EXISTING OR HEREAFTER ARISING, AND WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT, EQUITY OR OTHERWISE. EACH PARTY TO THIS AGREEMENT HEREBY AGREES AND CONSENTS THAT ANY SUCH CLAIM, DEMAND, ACTION OR CAUSE OF ACTION SHALL BE DECIDED BY COURT TRIAL WITHOUT A JURY AND THAT THE PARTIES TO THIS AGREEMENT MAY FILE AN ORIGINAL COUNTERPART OF A COPY OF THIS AGREEMENT WITH ANY COURT AS WRITTEN EVIDENCE OF THE CONSENT OF THE PARTIES HERETO TO THE WAIVER OF THEIR RIGHT TO TRIAL BY JURY.
ollama_generated: BOTH PARTIES, IN THE SCOPE PERMITTED BY LAW, WAIVE ANY RIGHT TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RELATION TO ALL CLAIMS, DISPUTES, OR LEGAL ACTIONS THAT MAY ARISE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, AS WELL AS THOSE RELATED TO THEIR DEALINGS CONNECTED WITH THIS AGREEMENT OR ANY TRANSACTIONS ASSOCIATED THEREWITH. IN ADDITION, BOTH PARTIES CONSENT THAT ANY SUCH DISPUTE SHALL BE SETTLED BY COURT ARBITRATION AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO A JURY TRIAL, AND AGREE TO SUBMIT AN ORIGINAL COPY OF THIS AGREEMENT TO THE COURT AS EVIDENCE OF OUR CONSENT TO THIS ARBITRATION PROVISION.

original: [Remainder of Page Intentionally Left Blank; Next Page is Signature Page] IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties hereto have executed this OMA as of the date first set forth above.
ollama_generated:
[Unsigned Pages Remaining; Execution Pages Commence on Next Page] WITH FULL UNDERSTANDING AND AGREEMENT, the Parties acknowledge and attest to this Obligation Management Agreement (OMA) as of the date initially indicated.

In this revised clause, the original "IN WITNESS WHEREOF" phrase has been replaced with "WITH FULL UNDERSTANDING AND AGREEMENT," signifying an enhanced level of awareness and consent from the parties involved. The intentionally left-blank pages are now described as "unsigned pages remaining," emphasizing the requirement for subsequent pages to be signed, while the execution pages are now referred to as beginning on the next page, providing a clearer indication of where the signatures should appear.
